title: Troy Polamalu's cousin unharmed in Oregon college massacre
text:
Cousin of former Steelers safety Troy Polamalu unharmed in Oregon mass shooting Authorities say 13 dead after man opens fire at Umpqua Community College UPDATED 5:46 PM EDT Oct 01, 2015 Photos KPTV via Newsource 
A cousin of former Pittsburgh Steelers safety Troy Polamalu works as a professor at Umpqua Community College in Oregon and was on campus Thursday when a man opened fire and killed at least 13 people. Oregon shooting: Gunman dead after college rampage 
The man who opened fire at Oregon's Umpqua Community College on Thursday is dead, Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin told reporters. 
No police officers were injured, but preliminary information indicates 10 people were killed and more than 20 others i... 
Brandon Polamalu, who teaches English and writing at Snyder Hall, was unharmed and texted his family quickly after the shooting, his mother told Pittsburgh's Action News 4. 
"There's a shooting on campus. I'm ok mom," said the text message to Shelley Polamalu. 
Sheriff John Hanlin, of Douglas County, Oregon, said that the shooter was killed in an exchange of gunfire with officers. He has not been identified yet. 
Brandon Polamalu and other faculty members are locked down and waiting to be transported away from campus to a secure location where family members can pick them up, Shelley Polamalu said. 
Troy Polamalu grew up in Oregon, about 15 miles from the school. His aunt is the mother of Brandon Polamalu.
